verses.text: Woe to thee that spoilest, and thou \add wast\add* not spoiled; And dealest treacherously, and they dealt not treacherously with thee! When thou shalt cease to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; \add And\add* when thou shalt make an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacherously with thee.
O \sc Lord\sc*, be gracious unto us; we have waited for thee: Be thou their arm every morning, Our salvation also in the time of trouble.
At the noise of the tumult the people fled; At the lifting up of thyself the nations were scattered.
And your spoil shall be gathered \add like\add* the gathering of the caterpillar: As the running to and fro of locusts shall he run upon them.
The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* exalted; for he dwelleth on high: He hath filled Zion \add with\add* judgment and righteousness.
And wisdom and knowledge shall be The stability of thy times, \add and\add* strength of salvation: The fear of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* his treasure.
Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: The ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.
The highways lie waste, the wayfaring man ceaseth: He hath broken the covenant, He hath despised the cities, he regardeth no man.
The earth mourneth \add and\add* languisheth: Lebanon is ashamed \add and\add* hewn down: Sharon is like a wilderness; And Bashan and Carmel shake off \add their fruits\add*.
Now will I rise, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; Now will I be exalted; Now will I lift up myself.
Ye shall conceive chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: Your breath, \add as\add* fire, shall devour you.
And the people shall be \add as\add* the burnings of lime: \add As\add* thorns cut up shall they be burnt in the fire.
Hear, ye \add that are\add* far off, what I have done; And ye \add that are\add* near, acknowledge my might.
The sinners in Zion are afraid; Fearfulness hath surprised the hypocrites. Who among us shall dwell \add with\add* the devouring fire? Who amongst us shall dwell \add with\add* everlasting burnings?

He that walketh righteously, and speaketh uprightly; He that despiseth the gain of oppressions, That shaketh his hands from holding of bribes, That stoppeth his ears from hearing of blood, And shutteth his eyes from seeing evil;
He shall dwell on high: His place of defence \add shall be\add* the munitions of rocks: Bread \add shall be\add* given him; his waters \add shall be\add* sure.
Thine eyes shall see the king in his beauty: They shall behold the land that is very far off.
Thine heart shall meditate terror. Where \add is\add* the scribe? where \add is\add* the receiver? Where \add is\add* he that counted the towers?
Thou shalt not see a fierce people, A people of a deeper speech than \add thou\add* canst perceive; Of a stammering tongue, \add that thou canst\add* not understand.

Look upon Zion, the city of our solemnities: Thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a quiet habitation, A tabernacle \add that\add* shall not be taken down; Not one of the stakes thereof shall ever be removed, Neither shall any of the cords thereof be broken.
But there the glorious \sc Lord\sc* \add will be\add* unto us A place of broad rivers \add and\add* streams; Wherein shall go no galley with oars, Neither shall gallant ship pass thereby.
For the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* our judge, the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* our lawgiver, The \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* our king; he will save us.
Thy tacklings are loosed; They could not well strengthen their mast, they could not spread the sail: Then is the prey of a great spoil divided; The lame take the prey.
And the inhabitant shall not say, I am sick: The people that dwell therein \add shall be\add* forgiven \add their\add* iniquity.
